content.webTitle: Toulouse chasing Leicester and England centre Manu Tuilagi

fields.headline: Toulouse chasing Leicester and England centre Manu Tuilagi
fields.bodyText: Leicester’s Manu Tuilagi is a target for Toulouse, according to reports. The centre will miss the World Cup for England after having been convicted on three charges of assault, two of which are against female police officers. However, if he were to make the move to France he may have played his last game for England, as Stuart Lancaster has maintained the policy of not selecting those – such as Steffon Armitage (Toulon) and Nick Abendanon (Clermont) – who play outside of England. Tuilagi is contracted to Leicester until 2017, but the French broadcaster RMC has reported that “contact has been established between the English international and the chairman of the Stade Toulousain, Rene Bouscatel.” Leicester will be dismayed by the news, having stood by Tuilagi during his latest controversy and in 2011 when he marked the end of the World Cup by jumping from a ferry in Auckland Harbour.
